[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the XO
to report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1299 a and today's date is June
6 2017 and the thought of the episode is
the last stage of popping the bubbles
has begun it's only a matter of time
let's get into the economic collapse
financial news now we're starting to see
a lot of problems in the economy and
it's getting worse we've been looking at
retail and we are seeing that retail
stores they are closing left and right
bankruptcies are happening and it's not
just in the retail industry it's
happening in every single sector but in
the retail industry it is really
noticeable and Macy's they're saying
that their profit margin well it's not
going to be where they think it's going
to be it's going to be about 60 to 80
basis points lower
and remember they made this forecast
back in February and they're starting to
realize well things aren't going to be
as good as we thought and a lot of
stores are starting to look at this and
say okay yes we had a projection we
projected it out for the rest of this
year but it looks like we're not going
to hit any of these goals and things are
a lot worse than we originally thought
now remember prior to 2008 going into
2008 we started to see a rise in
consumer and business bankruptcies and
of course they skyrocketed right after
the market fell in 2008 going into 2009
and we're starting to see the same exact
thing happened once again we see
consumer and business bankruptcies well
they're rising again after they've been
declining since at my own 2010 to 2015
and this is not a good sign bankruptcy
filings for businesses from large
corporations to tiny sole
proprietorships well that started back
in November of 2015 and at first it was
the energy bust and people well it was
the energy sector we could see what
happened prices came down and they
couldn't operate and things started to
fall apart
but the bankruptcies of these energy
companies they have tapered off and what
we're seeing right now is that the
bankruptcies in the retail sector in
consumer sector well they're starting to
pick up the slack so really here we go
again total US business bankruptcies in
May rose by four point seven percent
year-over-year and there are about three
thousand five hundred seventy two
filings and this is according to the
american bankruptcy institute that's up
40 percent from May 2015 and up ten
percent from May 2014 and there's
another concern bankruptcy filings are
highly seasonal they peak in the tax
season around March or April and then
they fall off so the decline in April
after the peak of March was within the
seasonal pattern but over the past years
filings dropped in May but not this year
this year they jumped and what we're
seeing is total u.s. bankruptcy files
and filings by consumers and businesses
in May rose by 5.3 percent
year-over-year to 69 thousand consumers
at risk of seeking bankruptcy protection
are those with insurmountable piles of
debt and a stagnating or declining real
income and we saw this back in 2007-2008
now the amount of debt is driven by
student loans auto loans revolving
credit like credit cards and we can see
and also medical bills and treatment
that's that's all plays into this
normally not mortgages mortgages people
say okay you know what I can take a loan
or an equity loan and I'll be fine but
normally this happens with student loans
auto loans and the things that we
mentioned and what we're seeing right
now is that there's a lot of this debt
credit card debt is around one trillion
it is just one notch below the peak
during the financial crisis
loan balances outstanding have surged 30
36 percent from the pre-crisis peak in
2006 to 1.1 2 trillion and student loan
balances outstanding have surged a
hundred and eighty percent of the same
period to one point four four trillion
this amounts to over three point five
trillion plus medical debts and we're
starting to see bankruptcies increase
where in the past they decreased during
this period so it looks like things are
repeating what we saw back in 2008-2009
it looks like we're back in that same
situation now we understand that the
budget well that only takes us to
September 30th that trillion dollar
budget they passed we understand that
the debt ceiling is coming up and the
government is running out of money which
means there's going to be a shutdown it
really doesn't affect the people but it
looks really really good on the
corporate media and people get all
scared but all your services and
everything
well they don't cease to exist they
continue on but we see House Minority
Leader Nancy Pelosi she is out there and
she is saying that they're going to use
the debt ceiling as leverage to stop
Trump's tax proposals and at this point
looking at Trump and looking at his
actions I don't think he really cares
because he understands that the economy
is not going to last the way it is right
now even if the debt ceiling is raised
if it's not raised it makes no
difference the amount of debt the amount
of tax receipts coming in it just can't
work any more any realizes it so if the
debt ceiling is raised which is going to
add more debt more people are going to
lose their jobs tax receipts coming into
the government will not be able to
support the debt if the debt ceiling is
not raised well guess what government is
shut down the longer it goes well the
more the government is not spending and
what it means is a lot of departments
will start to close slowly but surely
and it's a waiting game because no
matter which way we look at it
the economy is going to collapse and we
know that these individuals in
government it looks really bad if they
keep something shut down for a long
period of time and yes she might be
saying that she's going to use this as
leverage but guess what just like the
Republicans they will always give in and
they will raise the debt ceiling and
this is exactly what he wants them to do
he wants the debt ceiling raised because
he realizes he understands that he needs
to continually add more to the debt we
need to blow up these bubbles we need to
bring down the system his strategy is
not to repair the economy that were in
today his strategy is to collapse the
economy that were in today and then
rebuild it through the transition this
is what he's been preparing for now we
can see that the central bankers they
are out there trying to make it look
like the economy is doing fantastic and
they want to do this because they're on
the other side now looking at Trump
saying okay we need to bring this down
before he does because we need to
control the narrative and the way the
central bank needs to do it yes can they
just push a button and just have
everything come to an end of course they
can but that wouldn't look natural that
wouldn't look like a natural crash so
what they need to do is they get the
insiders out out of the stock market
they bring in the retail investors like
the Millennials which now we see on the
corporate media they're out there saying
that since the financial crisis has
ended about a year ago Millennials who
were a little nervous about investing
well they're looking at the market once
again and it looks like maybe they'll
start investing in the market because
they can see that it's stable and it
continually moves up and it looks like
maybe now it's time now this is an
article which they're putting out there
this one's on market watch it is to
convince everyone that everything is
fine in the economy to get people into
the stock market
so the insiders can pull out the retail
investors that come in because they know
the bubble is about to pop this is what
they do in real estate
once all the speculators are out there
and they have the
information and they realize the housing
bubbles at its maximum what they do is
they start selling off their properties
and the retail investors come in and
they start purchasing tons of them
thinking that the markets going to
continually rise and then all of a
sudden everything comes crashing down so
we are at that point where we're going
to see everything start to fall apart
now we need to remember something very
important here the central bank they
really don't have any more tools to keep
this economy going yes they can use
stimulus they might pass stimulus off
from country to country
we had Mark Zuckerberg out there talking
about universal basic income where
they're going to give cash to
individuals we know this is not going to
work this is going to cause inflation
which means that there's going to be
more currency in the economy which is
going to devalue the currency and it's
going to cause more debt the tax
receipts coming in will not be able to
support this and eventually this will
crash the economy yes it will work for a
short period of time very short and then
things will start to unravel so what do
they have left well they have nothing
left and this is the major problem now
what I see happening here is when things
start to fall apart we're going to see
it happen on the outskirts around the
world what I mean by that we're going to
see it happen in many different
countries of course we're going to see
it in the emerging markets first the
smaller countries it's going to head to
Europe and then eventually here to
United States just like we saw back in
the Great Depression now what's very
interesting is South Africa well they
just plunged into a recession so we're
starting to see financial institutions
continually fail we had Deutsche Bank
which had to be bailed out we had
Italian banks that had to be bailed out
we say Banco Popular in Spain which
needs a bail in or some type of investor
to step in we see home capital in Canada
which is a complete disaster
and now we have South Africa that just
entered a recession and we can see the
GDP numbers are way down they tumble
down to about 0.7%
which is very interesting which is very
close to the United States GDP numbers
and we can see that it's already
starting on the outskirts and it will
work its way in very slowly now the
central bankers realizes and we have to
remember something very important we are
now coming off of the dollar oil dollar
system which is the petrodollar system
now why Trump is doing everything behind
the scenes and actually a little bit
later in the next report I'm going to
explain why the corporate media might be
catching on right now about what he's
really doing what we see happening right
now is his he's working behind the
scenes trying to get everything set up
he's looking at the land reviewing the
land that the president's put aside he's
looking at financial resources he's
looking at oil offshore drilling
drilling in Alaska because he realizes
once we come off the petrodollar guess
what the oil that we're receiving from
the Middle East is going to freeze up
just like it did back in 1971 when we
were going on the oil petro dollar
system well we couldn't get oil in there
until the deal was made and this is why
people this is why the corporate media
and the government was out there saying
there were shortages no it was because
they were coming off the gold system
moving on to the petro dollar system and
everything wasn't ironed out and we see
we're on the back end of this now
remember trade he said is very important
yes we need to have some type of trade
why because what we do today is
countries they receive the dollars they
use those dollars to buy our goods that
we manufacturing and manufacturing has
left this country so we're we have less
to give these countries and it wasn't
like when we first went out to the
system where we had many many things to
give these countries now we have a lot
less because all manufacturing has left
this country so when we come off the
dollar petro dollar system guess what
these countries don't need to hold the
dollar anymore they're not going to be
purchasing our goods with the dollar
anymore so they will be off the dollar
system which means we're going to need
to produce and trade with other
trees and this is what is being set up
right now it might be hard to see but
this is the plan this is why trade is is
so important this is why joining the
belt and road is so important he
unraveled the TPP this global a system
that they wanted to keep the system
going and bring the country down to a
third world nation he removed us from
the Paris climate Accord because what is
happening right now is he understands
and those individuals in that government
that are behind him understand that this
system it's coming to an end and
everything has to be in place now we're
going to go through a transition period
just like we did coming off the gold
system going onto the petrodollar system
and many people think wow it was great
then because you know my house price
went up my income went up well what you
didn't realize was there was so much
printing of money and as we came off the
gold standard the dollar devalued that's
why you saw inflation the way you did
that's why they raised the interest
rates the way they did to try to control
it now we're on the back end interest
rates very low wages going down we don't
see inflation right now we will because
they give the dollar is going to devalue
quite a bit when all these countries
don't need to hold on to the dollar
anymore so we're on the back end of all
of this we're going to go through this
transition the corporate media is going
to be out there telling you how terrible
everything's going to be everything that
he's doing is going to be awful it's not
going to work this is the mouthpiece of
the deep state this is what the
corporate media does but this is in
preparation for the new system and we're
going to go through this transition this
transition is going to be difficult
because all those products that we've
been receiving from China the oil that
we've been receiving food products
that's going to come to a screeching
halt until we get on to this new system
so there's going to be a time period
where the entire economy will not be
operational and this is what we are
getting prepared for this is what we've
been talking about food water cash on
hand gold and silver to protect your
wealth a weapon because people are not
going to be prepared for what is
happening this is
what we've been talking about all along
and we are on that other end where we're
coming off of this petrol dollar system
and it's not going to be easy remember
we have all this debt and all these
countries around the world are going to
say okay it's not backed by oil anymore
the dollar is not backed by gold it's
worth nothing and it and there's debt
there's so much debt attached to it why
do we want to hold this and they're
going to take it and say we don't want
this anymore and all those dollars are
going to flood back to the United States
and we're going to see inflation which
is a lot of currency and circulation and
the devaluation of the dollar so get
prepared
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
